title: A new approach to the Age-Period-Cohort Identification Problem
abstractText:
This project will examine a promising new solution to a statistical problem (the "Age-Period-Cohort or APC problem") that is relevant to applied research in disciplines including economics, sociology, epidemiology and demography.

The problem arises whenever researchers are interested in how peoples' circumstance can be quantitatively decomposed into an effect associated with their age, the year in which they are observed (the period), and the year in which they are born (their cohort). Standard statistical and econometric techniques cannot be used in these circumstances.

The method that we propose to apply to the APC problem has been used to address problems of a similar nature in the other disciplines and its application to one of the longest standing statistical problems in the social sciences is overdue.

The APC problem has recently been relevant to research questions as diverse as how saving behaviour varies as people age (in various countries), breast cancer incidence (in China), subjective measures of happiness (USA), propensity to commit suicide (Switzerland), and productivity of scientific researchers (France).
